definition: to go into battle
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration
lit. to go into battle bare-breasted (idiom)/fig. to go all out/to come out in the open
to go into battle/to strike at the enemy

sentences.english: Laureen approves her husband's political views and once canvassed for him.
sentences.chinese: 她赞同丈夫的政治观点，并亲自开车上阵为丈夫助选。

sentences.english: And the king of Israel disguised himself， and went into the battle.
Hungarian V43 EL was standing-by at the border of Austria and Hungary.
sentences.chinese: 奥匈边境等待上阵的匈牙利V43型电力机车。

sentences.english: Toure has had similar match-time due to illness and a hip problem.
sentences.chinese: 图雷因为患病和一个臀部问题也只上阵了相同的时间。

sentences.english: The one who followed me to try is the most famous senior hiker House Rain.
sentences.chinese: 接下来上阵的是著名强驴小楼听雨。

sentences.english: Gerard taught me a lot and he gave me the confidence to play.
sentences.chinese: 热拉尔教会我很多，他给予我为利物浦上阵的自信。

sentences.english: However no tricks were necessary for the surfing scenes because Hamilton herself did the breathtaking wave riding.
sentences.chinese: 因为这些冲浪的场景都是由汉米尔顿亲自上阵的。

sentences.english: God's people would go to war whenever he called on them.
sentences.chinese: 只要神一呼召，神的子民便会披甲上阵。

sentences.english: That limited the rate of fire would very limited even with rotation.
sentences.chinese: 即使枪手们轮番上阵，所能节省的时间也非常有限。

sentences.english: For many athletes, playing through injuries is standard practice.
sentences.chinese: 对很多运动员而言，负伤上阵是标准的做法。
谁该更多的赤膊上阵呢？

sentences.english: He played six minutes of first-team football in three years.
sentences.chinese: 在三年时间里，他仅仅为俱乐部一队上阵6分钟。

sentences.english: Travel lighter on your journey with an open heart and feel alive.
sentences.chinese: 带着一棵开放的心轻装上阵，活力四射。

sentences.english: Gu five personally to kill, destroy Turkic army.
sentences.chinese: 顾小五亲自上阵杀敌，突厥全军履灭。

sentences.english: England's World Cup hero is determined to play through the pain barrier .
sentences.chinese: 英格兰的世界杯英雄决定带伤上阵。

definition: to charge and break through enemy lines
to attack the enemy
to go into battle/to campaign (military)
to take up a challenge/to face an attack and meet it
combat/to fight
on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
to be wounded/to sustain an injury
to bring up the rear/to provide support/to hold the lines
to drill troops/army training
real swords, real spears (idiom)/real weapons/very much for real/every bit real/the genuine article
to fight with all one has
to fight at the head of one's troops/(fig.) to take the lead
to fight with all one's might
to grapple (with the enemy)/to fight at the risk of one's life
campaign/expedition
